verses.verse: And the Pharisees <WG5330> and some <WG5100> of the scribes <WG1122> gathered <WG4863> together <WG4863> around <WG4314> Him when they had come <WG2064> from Jerusalem, <WG2414>
and had seen <WG3708> that some <WG5100> of His disciples <WG3101> were eating <WG2068> their bread <WG740> with impure <WG2839> hands, <WG5495> that is, unwashed. <WG449>

(For the Pharisees <WG5330> and all <WG3956> the Jews <WG2453> do not eat <WG2068> unless <WG1437> <WG3361> they carefully <WG4435> wash <WG3538> their hands, <WG5495> [thus] observing <WG2902> the traditions <WG3862> of the elders; <WG4245>

and [when they come] from the market <WG58> place, <WG58> they do not eat <WG2068> unless <WG1437> <WG3361> they cleanse <WG4472> themselves; and there are many <WG4183> other <WG243> things <WG4183> which <WG3739> they have received <WG3880> in order to observe, <WG2902> such as the washing <WG909> of cups <WG4221> and pitchers <WG3582> and copper <WG5473> pots. <WG5473>)

And the Pharisees <WG5330> and the scribes <WG1122> asked <WG1905> Him, "Why <WG1223> <WG5101> do Your disciples <WG3101> not walk <WG4043> according <WG2596> to the tradition <WG3862> of the elders, <WG4245> but eat <WG2068> their bread <WG740> with impure <WG2839> hands <WG5495>?"

And He said <WG3004> to them, " Rightly <WG2573> did Isaiah <WG2268> prophesy <WG4395> of you hypocrites, <WG5273> as it is written, <WG1125> 'This <WG3778> people <WG2992> honors <WG5091> Me with their lips, <WG5491> But their heart <WG2588> is far <WG4206> away <WG568> <WG4206> from Me.
'But in vain <WG3155> do they worship <WG4576> Me, Teaching <WG1321> as doctrines <WG1319> the precepts <WG1778> of men. <WG444>'
"Neglecting <WG863> the commandment <WG1785> of God, <WG2316> you hold <WG2902> to the tradition <WG3862> of men. <WG444>"
He was also <WG2532> saying <WG3004> to them, "You nicely <WG2573> set <WG114> aside <WG114> the commandment <WG1785> of God <WG2316> in order <WG2443> to keep <WG5083> your tradition. <WG3862>

"For Moses <WG3475> said, <WG3004> 'Honor <WG5091> your father <WG3962> and your mother <WG3384>'; and, 'He who speaks <WG2551> evil <WG2551> of father <WG3962> or <WG2228> mother, <WG3384> let him be put <WG5053> to death <WG2288>';

but you say, <WG3004> 'If <WG1437> a man <WG444> says <WG3004> to [his] father <WG3962> or <WG2228> [his] mother, <WG3384> anything <WG3739> <WG1437> of mine <WG1473> you might have been helped <WG5623> by is Corban <WG2878> (that is to say, given <WG1435> [to God]),'
you no <WG3765> longer <WG3765> permit <WG863> him to do <WG4160> anything <WG3762> for [his] father <WG3962> or <WG2228> [his] mother; <WG3384>

[thus] invalidating <WG208> the word <WG3056> of God <WG2316> by your tradition <WG3862> which <WG3739> you have handed <WG3860> down; <WG3860> and you do <WG4160> many <WG4183> things <WG4183> such <WG3946> as that. "
And after He called <WG4341> the multitude <WG3793> to Him again, <WG3825> He [began] saying <WG3004> to them, "Listen <WG191> to Me, all <WG3956> of you, and understand: <WG4920>

there is nothing <WG3762> outside <WG1855> the man <WG444> which going <WG1531> into him can <WG1410> defile <WG2840> him; but the things which proceed <WG1607> out of the man <WG444> are what defile <WG2840> the man. <WG444>
["If <WG1487> any <WG5100> man <WG5100> has <WG2192> ears <WG3775> to hear, <WG191> let him hear. <WG191>"]
And when <WG3753> leaving <WG575> the multitude, <WG3793> He had entered <WG1525> the house, <WG3624> His disciples <WG3101> questioned <WG1905> Him about the parable. <WG3850>

And He said <WG3004> to them, "Are you so <WG3779> lacking <WG801> in understanding <WG801> also <WG2532>? Do you not understand <WG3539> that whatever <WG3956> goes <WG1531> into the man <WG444> from outside <WG1855> cannot <WG1410> <WG3756> defile <WG2840> him;

because <WG3754> it does not go <WG1531> into his heart, <WG2588> but into his stomach, <WG2836> and is eliminated <WG1519> <WG856> <WG1607>?" ([Thus He] declared <WG2511> all <WG3956> foods <WG1033> clean. <WG2511>)
And He was saying, <WG3004> "That which proceeds <WG1607> out of the man, <WG444> that is what defiles <WG2840> the man. <WG444>

"For from within, <WG2081> out of the heart <WG2588> of men, <WG444> proceed <WG1607> the evil <WG2556> thoughts, <WG1261> fornications, <WG4202> thefts, <WG2829> murders, <WG5408> adulteries, <WG3430>
deeds <WG4124> of coveting <WG4124> [and] wickedness, <WG4189> [as well as] deceit, <WG1388> sensuality, <WG766> envy, <WG3788> <WG4190> slander, <WG988> pride <WG5243> [and] foolishness. <WG877>
"All <WG3956> these <WG3778> evil <WG4190> things <WG4190> proceed <WG1607> from within <WG2081> and defile <WG2840> the man. <WG444>"

And from there <WG1564> He arose <WG450> and went <WG565> away <WG565> to the region <WG3725> of Tyre. <WG5184> And when He had entered <WG1525> a house, <WG3614> He wanted <WG2309> no <WG3762> one <WG3762> to know <WG1097> [of it;] yet <WG2532> He could <WG1410> not escape <WG2990> notice. <WG2990>

But after hearing <WG191> of Him, a woman <WG1135> whose <WG3739> little <WG2365> daughter <WG2365> had <WG2192> an unclean <WG169> spirit, <WG4151> immediately <WG2117> came <WG2064> and fell <WG4363> at His feet. <WG4228>

Now <WG1161> the woman <WG1135> was a Gentile, <WG1674> of the Syrophoenician <WG4949> race. <WG1085> And she kept asking <WG2065> Him to cast <WG1544> the demon <WG1140> out of her daughter. <WG2364>

And He was saying <WG3004> to her, "Let <WG863> the children <WG5043> be satisfied <WG5526> first, <WG4413> for it is not good <WG2570> to take <WG2983> the children's bread <WG740> and throw <WG906> it to the dogs. <WG2952>"

But she answered <WG611> and said <WG3004> to Him, "Yes, <WG3483> Lord, <WG2962> [but] even <WG2532> the dogs <WG2952> under <WG5270> the table <WG5132> feed <WG2068> on the children's crumbs. <WG5589>"
And He said <WG3004> to her, "Because <WG1223> of this <WG3778> answer <WG3056> go <WG5217> your way; <WG5217> the demon <WG1140> has gone <WG1831> out of your daughter. <WG2364>"
And going <WG565> back <WG565> to her home, <WG3624> she found <WG2147> the child <WG3813> lying <WG906> on the bed, <WG2825> the demon <WG1140> having departed. <WG1831>

And again <WG3825> He went <WG1831> out from the region <WG3725> of Tyre, <WG5184> and came <WG2064> through <WG1223> Sidon <WG4605> to the Sea <WG2281> of Galilee, <WG1056> within <WG303> <WG3319> the region <WG3725> of Decapolis. <WG1179>
And they brought <WG5342> to Him one <WG2974> who <WG2974> was deaf <WG2974> and spoke <WG3424> with difficulty, <WG3424> and they entreated <WG3870> Him to lay <WG2007> His hand <WG5495> upon him.

And He took <WG618> him aside <WG618> from the multitude <WG3793> by himself, <WG2398> and put <WG906> His fingers <WG1147> into his ears, <WG3775> and after spitting, <WG4429> He touched <WG681> his tongue <WG1100> [with the saliva;]
and looking <WG308> up to heaven <WG3772> with a deep <WG4727> sigh, <WG4727> He said <WG3004> to him, "Ephphatha! <WG2188>" that is, "Be opened! <WG1272>"
And his ears <WG189> were opened, <WG455> and the impediment <WG1199> of his tongue <WG1100> was removed, <WG3089> and he [began] speaking <WG2980> plainly. <WG3723>

And He gave <WG1291> them orders <WG1291> not to tell <WG3004> anyone; <WG3367> but the more <WG3745> He ordered <WG1291> them, the more <WG3123> widely <WG4053> they continued to proclaim <WG2784> it.

And they were utterly <WG5249> astonished, <WG1605> saying, <WG3004> "He has done <WG4160> all <WG3956> things <WG3956> well; <WG2573> He makes <WG4160> even <WG2532> the deaf <WG2974> to hear, <WG191> and the dumb <WG216> to speak. <WG2980>"
